Come flame of the sky...  81. She stops, not liking the delivery. She closes her eyes to get into the moment.
Young Gus looks at her and smiles, enchanted. He's falling for her. Present Day Gus looks at himself, empathetic.

Caroline takes a deep breath, starts over. CAROLINE (CONT'D) (cont’d) Come, flame by sky, Pierce through my head! What do I gain from living any longer? Oh how I hate living! I want to end my life, leave it behind, and die. She's good.
Young Gus is drawn to her, emerges from the shadows. He wants to go down, but suddenly...
Another figure emerges from the side of the stage.
Young Gus withdraws back into the shadows.

Steven Riordan joins his sister. A camera slung around his neck. He takes a picture of her CAROLINE (CONT'D) (cont'd) C'mon, Steven. I'm trying to practice. He takes another shot. She's annoyed but loves the attention of the camera. CAROLINE (CONT'D) (cont’d) Go away! I need to learn my lines. He takes another shot, then places the camera down.  82.
What madness is this? The bed you long for - Is it what others shrink from? Is it death that you demand? While reciting lines, Steven circles her taking pictures. She laughs at him.
You missed a few lines.
See? You know it. You don't need to practice. He keeps taking shots, getting closer to her. She's getting into it, posing and acting coy.
Stop... He is only a few inches from her. He stops taking shots and places the camera down. He looks at his beautiful sister. She gazes back at him.

Young Gus watches the interaction between Caroline and her brother with morbid fascination. Steven leans into his sister for a kiss. It looks like their lips will meet but she pushes him away. She laughs and runs behind the stage.
Caroline and Steven play a flirtatious game, running after each other. Steven traps her against a wall, holds his arms out pinning him in between.
What are you doing?

No one's here.  83. She ducks under his arms and runs to a corner and sits on a desk. Steven approaches her slowly. He takes the camera and begins to take pictures again, the flash explodes with each shot. She loves the attention of the camera. She leans back on her hands, and lets him take pictures of her. It's as if the camera is making love to her. Steven finally let's go of the camera. He's directly in front of her, between her legs. He touches her thigh. STEVEN (CONT’D) But I’m here. I’m always going to be, Caroline. I’m going to take care of you. She protests but her passion is clearly overwhelming. His hand travels up her thigh, disappearing between her skirt. She moans. He leans in and tenderly kisses her neck then travels up to her lips. They kiss passionately.
Young Gus, is horrified. He takes a step back and the catwalk CREAKS.
Caroline and Steven jump, surprised. Caroline gathers herself.
Who's there? Caroline runs out. Steven looks around and stares straight at Present Day Gus before running out after his sister.
Present Day Gus looks around at the empty theater. The set disappears as the memory fades. He stands alone.
Gus stands out of breath still reeling from the memory. He scrambles for his phone and dials.  84. An uneasy feeling begins to fall on Gus.
Mike?!!
Mike is walking thru the party, cell phone pressed to his ear. He’s opening doors, looking for something.
Hang on. Let me find someplace quiet. He opens one last door, seeing an office, walks in.
Mike closes the door behind him, the THUMPING music fading into background noise. It’s dark, he switches a desk lamp on.
I’m about to close a massive deal. It’s gonna put me back on top. Can we make this quick?
Listen to me. I need you to remember Caroline Riordan. From Evergreen. Mike closes his eyes and thinks.
Doesn’t ring a bell.
(angry) . C'mon, this is important. Think! She killed herself. The door to the office opens, and the music SWELLS. Mike holds a finger up, not looking back - SOMEBODY’S entered the room.

(to visitor) I’1l be with you in a second.  85. The door closes, and the music is muffled into background noise once more. Mike plays with a pendulum. Behind him a FIGURE stands waiting in the dark...
Gus looks on at the car, impatiently. Anna still sleeps.
Is someone there with you?
Yeah I gotta go...
Wait! She had long dark hair. She was in theater. The same year as we were.
Mike begins to remember.
Wait, I do remember that chick. That crazy girl. (beat ) She drowned herself in the river. It was fucked up.
Why?
Man, she was a total slut. Slept with everyone. (beat ) Oh shit. She was fucking her brother! The FIGURE IN SHADOW shuffles, moves forward towards Mike.
How could you forget something like that?  86.
It was so long ago. Who knows what’s true. Anyway, she died, end of story. No one cared. The FIGURE MOVES in CLOSER...
Gus comes to a realization.
You told everyone! (beat ) It was you...
We see Mike as Young Mike, on the phone. The FIGURE is just behind Mike.
Fuck you man. That’s a shitty thing to say...
But you did.
Maybe I told a few people. But I wasn’t the one that started it.
Gus talks on the phone, agitated.
Then who did?
Mike and Gus walk their bikes, backpacks slung behind them. Gus has a pre-occupied look. He glances over to Mike.  87.
(serious, subdued) I gotta tell you something, but you gotta swear not to tell anyone. Mike nods.
Young Mike on the phone, the DARK FIGURE towering above him.
Mike’s silence cuts Gus like a cruel accusation. He nearly doubles over at the realization.

Present day Mike holds the phone impatiently. The FIGURE behind Mike has his tie off, wrapped around his hands like piano wire. REVEAL: Steven lowers the tie around Mike’s neck strangles him. Mike drops his cell phone and grabs at the tie around his neck. Steven looks on focused, empowered by his passion and anger. Mike can only make choking noises as he struggles.
Gus can hear the struggle on the other end.
Mike? Hello? Mike!!!
Mike slumps over the desk, dead. Gus’ voice can be heard thru the cell phone, calling out for him. Steven grabs the cell phone, in tears.
My sister was not a slut. You hear me?!  88.
You sick son of a bitch!
Don’t feel too bad. Mike got what he deserved. Steven hangs up the phone.
Gus drives numb and emotionless. Ann awakens. She looks at him tenderly.

How long have I been asleep? Anna reaches out for him and touches his hand. Her touch pushes him over. He lets out a blood-curdling SCREAM. Anna just stares as he screams and screams, pounding the steering wheel, crying in anguish. CAMERA PULLS BACK thru the windshield, out of the car. We can still see Gus screaming, but we can no longer hear him:
We view his violent outburst from outside the car but can only hear the incredible silence of the desolate road.
Gus and Anna’s car drive up to motel.
Gus and Anna sit on the bed. She faces him, he faces the wall.
You got locked up for twenty years for saying that?
Whether it’s a pebble or a grain of sand in water they both sink alike.  89.
We beat the deadline.
Tomorrow is the anniversary of her death.

But that doesn’t matter. You wanted to know why. You have your answer. Now it’s over. Let’s just keep going. They stare into each others’ eyes, and it clearly affects Gus. Her earnestness grows. She senses that she may finally be reaching him - pushes further.

Someplace he can’t find us. We can start over. You can walk away. He struggles to answer her, but instead turns away and steels himself. Anna waits for any sign from him for a beat, then resigns herself to his silence. After a few moments, she takes his arm, rests her head against his shoulder.
Gus and Anna lie naked together in bed, post-coital deep sleep, her leg draped over his. ANGLE ON DOOR, as GAS seeps into the room through a crack at the bottom.

ECU on GAS MASK, a man’s face barely visible behind. It’s Steven and it looks like he’s smiling. He walks across the gas-filled room, to the bed where Anna and Gus sleep oblivious to his presence. He kneels down next to her, runs a finger along her exposed hip slowly sliding off what’s left of the covers, leaving her completely naked. Thru his gas mask, Steven’s breathing is loud and slow, like an astronaut exploring a new world.  90. He turns to look up at: LARRY standing by the door. He too wears a gas mask. In his hands he holds an elegantly wrapped gift box.
The sun has risen. It’s a new day.

Anna and Gus hover over the strange gift box, bewildered by its presence. Gus cautiously opens it. CLOSE ON BOX: Sitting there on a velvet cushion, is a man’s severed HAND. We’1ll recognize the ostentatious ring as belonging to Toph. She stares at it a long beat, before collapsing on the ground unconscious.
Gus drives Mike’s jaguar back to the city. INT. MIKE’S CAR - DAY Gus is stonefaced. Anna looks out the window.
We don’t have to do this.
We have no choice. There’s no where safe for us. Until I end it.
Gus and Anna walk through the hallway of Toph's public storage building. Toph's lackeys watch him pass by suspiciously.
What are we doing here?  91. Gus doesn't answer, focused. Anna looks at him unsure. Gus walks on as Anna scurries after him.

Gus and Anna enter the room followed by Toph's thugs. Toph sits with his back to them. Slowly, he swivels around to reveal that his hand has been replaced by a prosthetic. He looks at them, then subconsciously rubs his fake hand.
We need to talk. Alone. After staring into his eyes, Toph waves his prosthetic at his thugs, who grab onto Anna and lead her away.
Gus. (to the thugs) Let go of me you assholes. Gus looks at her.
Go with them. The thugs lead her away, as she makes it difficult. When they're out of sight, Gus approaches Toph and takes a seat opposite him.
It looks like we've both got a score to settle. Gus gives him the ostentatious ring. Toph takes it, strokes it nostalgically.
It appears that way.
Tell me where he is. Toph looks at him contemplating the request.
Gus walks towards the exit alone. In the background, we hear Anna screaming and pleading.
Don’t leave me here! Gus! Gus keeps walking, knows it’s for the best
An enemy’s enemy is a friend, right (beat ) It’s in the theater district
If I don’t come back by tomorrow, let her go.
Marquee lights and neon signs switch off one by one. The theater district is sleeping.
Gus heads towards a warehouse space transformed into a theater. The marquee on the building reads: MEDEA. Gus tries the door. It's open.
Gus carefully enters the dimly lit theater lobby. He walks through the lobby passing stills from past productions. He hears voices inside the theater

Gus enters the darkened theater. Spotlights are positioned on stage as a young woman stands there. He takes a closer look, focusing on the woman’s face. All he can see is the young and beautiful Caroline reciting lines.  93.

Come, flame by sky, Pierce through my head! What do I gain from living any longer? Oh how I hate living! I want to end my life, leave it behind, and die. She looks straight at him, piercing him with her dark eyes as though looking straight into his soul. He closes his eyes and looks again: The young woman is not Caroline at all just an actress rehearsing. Gus shakes his head trying to shake the image from his mind. STAGE MANAGER’S VOICE (v.0.) (thru P.A. system) That's it for today folks, see you for dress rehearsal tomorrow. Actors disperse. Gus looks around trying to spot Steven. Suddenly, we hear a pair of hands CLAPPING. The sound echoing in the empty theater. Gus looks around trying to spot the source. The lights go out. All that remains is the spotlight focused on the stage.
From the darkness a dark figure emerges into the spotlight. Steven stands on stage CLAPPING.

Congratulations. You made it just in time. Furious, Gus runs up to the stage, bum-rushing Steven. He tackles him to the ground and starts pummeling him mercilessly. Steven doesn't make a move, not even to avoid being hit. Gus continues the onslaught of punches to Steve's face. Steven's head whips back as he spits out blood. Gus pauses trying to catch his breath. He seems animal- like.  94. Steve looks at him, bruised and bloody, works a smile on his lips. It looks like he may be enjoying this. STEVEN (CONT’D) Go ahead, kill me. Then you'll miss the best part. Gus gets up off him. Steven smiles through the blood.
There's so much more for you to learn.
Fuck you! I don't want to know anymore.
Then why are you here? Steven disappears behind the curtains of the stage. Gus watches him go, cautious. Is this a trap?
Gus walks through the backstage and sees a stairway. He looks up to see Steven at the top of the stairs.
Up here. Gus hesitates for a beat then follows up the stairs cautiously. Steven disappears into a door

Gus walks into a spacious penthouse apartment above the theater. We hear the somber tune of Mozart's Requiem. Gus looks around. The walls are adorned with framed pictures. On closer inspection, we see that the pictures are mostly of Caroline Riordan. At the center is a large striking picture of Caroline, trying to look happy. Behind her is a blurred picture of a river. Gus looks stares at the haunting picture. Steven gathers himself looking at a mirror, wiping the blood from his face.
I took that picture before she died.  95.
You took my life from me. Killed the people I loved and for what? Because I started a stupid rumor? Steven laughs at the irony.
A stupid rumor... (beat ) The rumor you started spread and spread, like a disease.
I didn't mean...
You weren't even around to see what you created.
It was a mistake.
That mistake cost me everything. Steven looks at the framed picture of Caroline at the river. He touches it.
I wasn't strong enough to hold on to her We zoom in on the picture as if comes to life.

Close on Caroline's smiling face as the picture comes alive. As widen out to reveal that Caroline is leaning of the bridge ready to plunge in the river. Steven is holding on to her right hand, crying, trying to keep her from her falling. She dangles precariously over a shallow river, spotted with jagged rocks. A camera, dangles around his neck. She looks up at him.
Don't cry. (beat ) Let me go.  96. Steven hangs on tighter.
Nooooo! She gathers a smile. With a her left hand she reaches over to the camera and clicks a picture of herself. The same picture now hanging on the loft.

Remember me. With that she unclasps her right hand, which begins to slip from Steven's grasp. He tries desperately to hold on but isn't strong enough. He loses his grip and she falls. Steven's POV of Caroline falling to the river below on her back, as if she's floating peacefully. He screams after her.
Steven looks at his hands. Gus looks on guiltily.
I'm sorry. Is that what you want? Steven looks at him furious.

The time for apologies is long over. Steven walks to his laptop and whirls it around towards Gus. Gus approaches the laptop and sees a window with an image. A surveillance video pointed into the storage room. In the room sits Anna
Anna sits on the bed staring at the clock. She looks over to her suitcase and pulls it towards her.  97.
Gus looks at the image on the screen, horrified.
You underestimated me.
Toph's strapped to a chair, with his right arm exposed. One of his thugs let him drink from a bottle of whiskey. Steven looks on in a corner, stoic. Toph takes a deep breath and nods to Steven.
(gritting it) Get it fucking over with. Steven nods to another thug next to him who takes out a hack saw. The thug approaches Toph and begins to saw off his arm. Toph screams in pain.
I worked my whole life to make money that means nothing to me.
But it shouldn’t surprise me how far people will go to get what they really want. These words ring in Gus's head. He doesn't know what to do.
She has nothing to do with this. Let her go. Steven spins around, furious. He slams his fist ona table, cracking the glass facade.
She has everything to do with this.  98.
Anna searches through her suitcase. Suddenly, the door opens and Toph walks in carrying a large gift box.
Gus watches from the laptop.
I swear to god if you hurt her...

That's all up to you. Steven’s bodyguard LARRY enters holding an ornate photo album. He hands it to Steven. Steven leafs through it. STEVEN (cont’d) You care about her don't you? Gus doesn't answer. STEVEN (CONT'D) (cont’d) It was so perfect. I spent so much time thinking about how I would do it. Make you feel the pain that I did. Then it hit. It was so perfect.
What are you talking about? Steven hands Gus the photo album. Gus looks at it, but doesn't take it.
Take it! Larry stands nearby, arms folded across his chest. Slowly, Gus's hand reaches out for the album.

Toph now sits on a chair by the bed. We see that he wears a holster with a gun.  99. Anna eyes the gun the gazes at the gift box he's placed by him. She continues to rummage through her suitcase finds what she's looking for. She takes out a wrinkled brown paper bag from her suitcase.

Gus takes the album and opens the first page. A newborn baby. Gus turns the page, pictures of Gus’s wife Kayla and Gus holding the baby. Gus begins to cry, seeing these images, revisiting old pain. He flips the page: more pictures of the baby, now wearing ANGEL WINGS. Then as a toddler on Christmas morning. Then as a little girl learning to ride a bike.

There's something about her. You must have felt it right away... Gus turns another page. Pictures of the girl as a teen. STEVEN (CONT'D) (cont’d) As if you've known her all your life. Gus's face becomes grim. A slow realization.
Anna pulls the contents of the brown paper bag. Something discernible...something white.
Gus, scared, turns to the final pages. A prom picture. Gus’s face goes ashen. The girl in the photos is ANNA.
Anna sits on the bed. The angel's wings strapped to her back like a security blanket.  100.
Gus crumbles to the ground in tears, broken. The room is spinning and he dry heaves.
What have you done?
I've made you fall in love. Gus clutches at his stomach, reeling in the fact that he's slept with his own daughter.
Now you know how I feel. Steven gets up and takes out a gun. Gus stares at it with a look of dread and longing. Steven smiles.
I'm not going to kill you. He sets the gun down next to Gus and walks away. He heads for his picture. STEVEN (cont’d) In the box next to Anna is that same album.

Anna, wearing the angel's wings, looks at the gift by her side. She puts a hand to it. She looks at Toph. Toph looks at the clock and shakes his head 'no.' She lifts her hands off the box and waits. Anna returns her gaze to the box.

Gus gets a look of rage. He curls his fingers into fists as he storms behind Steven. That’s when Larry steps in blocking his path. Gus throws several punches, but Larry is a seasoned fighter. They crash into each other like fierce animals. Larry brings Gus to the ground, trying to choke him out. But Gus outmaneuvers him, and gains leverage.  101. He jabs Larry in the throat, wrenches his arm too far to the left - SNAP! Larry isn’t giving up, grabs a clump of Gus’ hair. Gus head-butts him, causing blood to gush from Larry’s nose. He leaves Larry on the ground squirming scrambles to pick up the gun but Steven has it in his hands. He points it at Gus’s head. He motions for Gus to get up on his feet.
Please, I'm begging you. Don't show it to her. This is all my fault. Don't punish her. Gus gets up, defeated...blubbering.

(beat ) I'll do anything. Anything you want. Steven looks away from him and back to the picture. Steven stares into Caroline's eyes - a flash of anger that subsides as quickly as it came. Steven wraps his arm around Gus as they stand side by side facing opposite directions. Steven points the gun to Gus’s temple. One bullet and they both die.
The only thing I did wrong was to love her, Gus. Gus opens his eyes, stops trembling.

We loved each other and we were willing to live with that fact. (beat ) Now the question is, can you? Steven picks up the phone with his free hand and dials. He waits a beat until someone on the other line picks up.

(on the phone) Let her go... Hearing these words sparks Gus into action. He grabs the gun from Steven - and in the blink of an eye - spins around and pulls the trigger. The bullet flies through the air and lands in Steven’s head - flies out the other end.  102. For a moment, there is nothing bus silence. Gus and Steven stare at each other, a moment of unity and understanding. Steven’s face looks serene as if he’s finally reached some inner peace. He falls back, dead. Gus stands there with the gun still smoking in his hand.

Toph hears nothing but silence over the phone. He reaches for the gift box, hesitates. Then he lifts the cover. She takes out the album. Toph gets up off the chair and pulls out a train ticket from his pocket.
If I were you, I'd go as far away from here as possible. He throws the ticket on the bed and exits leaving the door wide open. Anna flips through the pages of the book
Gus drives alone in a jeep down a rural country road. Trees, mountains, peace.
Too many questions to answer, so I left them all behind. INT. GUS’ JEEP Gus’ hair has gone completely grey. His eyes have lost a bit of their former ferocity. His face is wrinkled, world-weary.
But wherever I went the questions followed. What is happiness? What is love? Where do we lay our hearts to rest and move on with our lives?  103. He turns up a small side road.

A small town diner. Anna, again working as a waitress, takes an order. There’s something different about her. She looks older, more mature, a bit distant — sadness lingers in her eyes. The BELLS of the door ring, signalling a new customer entering. She turns towards the door and sees... Gus, who also looks older and a bit worn down. They regard each other for a bit, not moving, not saying anything. He looks at her, longingly. He's torn by his decision but knows he can’t stay away. FADE TO BLACK.

THE ZOMBIES "TIME OF THE SEASON" AS CREDITS ROLL
